content.question: Which of the following statements about the thermodynamic favorability of the reaction at <math alttext="25 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>25</mn><mo rspace="0em">°</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math> is correct?

choices.label: The high activation energy results in the reaction being thermodynamically unfavorable.
Only the <math alttext="delta H naught" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Δ</mtext><mi>H</mi><mo>°</mo></math> of the reaction contributes to the reaction being thermodynamically favorable.
Only the <math alttext="delta S naught" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Δ</mtext><mi>S</mi><mo>°</mo></math> of the reaction contributes to the reaction being thermodynamically favorable.

Both the <math alttext="delta H naught" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Δ</mtext><mi>H</mi><mo>°</mo></math> and the <math alttext="delta S naught" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Δ</mtext><mi>S</mi><mo>°</mo></math> of the reaction contribute to the reaction being thermodynamically favorable.

content.answer: Both the <math alttext="delta H naught" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Δ</mtext><mi>H</mi><mo>°</mo></math> and the <math alttext="delta S naught" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Δ</mtext><mi>S</mi><mo>°</mo></math> of the reaction contribute to the reaction being thermodynamically favorable.

topic.text: 9.3: Gibbs Free Energy and Thermodynamic Favorability

skill.text: 5.B: Identify an appropriate theory, definition, or mathematical relationship to solve a problem.
